options.name: claimTokenFile
options.desc: If set, automatically registers the agent using the given claim token file.

options.name: config
options.desc: netdata.conf configuration as nix attributes. cannot be combined with configText.

options.name: configDir
options.desc: Complete netdata config directory except netdata.conf. The default configuration is merged with changes defined in this option. Each top-level attribute denotes a path in the configuration directory as in environment.etc. Its value is the absolute path and must be readable by netdata. Cannot be combined with configText.

options.name: configText
options.desc: Verbatim netdata.conf, cannot be combined with config.

options.name: deadlineBeforeStopSec
options.desc: In order to detect when netdata is misbehaving, we run a concurrent task pinging netdata (wait-for-netdata-up) in the systemd unit. If after a while, this task does not succeed, we stop the unit and mark it as failed. You can control this deadline in seconds with this option, it’s useful to bump it if you have (1) a lot of data (2) doing upgrades (3) have low IOPS/throughput.

options.name: enableAnalyticsReporting
options.desc: Enable reporting of anonymous usage statistics to Netdata Inc. via either Google Analytics (in versions prior to 1.29.4), or Netdata Inc.’s self-hosted PostHog (in versions 1.29.4 and later). See: https://learn.netdata.cloud/docs/agent/anonymous-statistics

options.name: extraPluginPaths
options.desc: Extra paths to add to the netdata global “plugins directory” option. Useful for when you want to include your own collection scripts. Details about writing a custom netdata plugin are available at: https://docs.netdata.cloud/collectors/plugins.d/ Cannot be combined with configText.

options.name: python.extraPackages
options.desc: Extra python packages available at runtime to enable additional python plugins.
options.type: function that evaluates to a(n) list of package

options.name: python.recommendedPythonPackages
options.desc: Whether to enable a set of recommended Python plugins by installing extra Python packages.

options.name: user
options.desc: User account under which netdata runs.
